trial_identification.studytitle: Correlation between postural pattern and level of physical activity in elderly women
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Correlation between postural pattern and level of physical activity in healthy elderly women

conditions.healthcondition: Postural screening intervention in healthy elderly women

conditioncode.conditioncode2: Normal musculoskeletal and cartilage development and function

interventions.interventions: Cross-sectional study with a sample of convenience of 70 participants of the Project for the Promotion of Health of the Elderly. Photogrammetry and flexicurve method were used to evaluate the standard posture of the volunteers. The level of older womens physical activity was evaluated by the International Physical Activity Questionnaire. Single 90 minute assessment session was performed. the overall duration of this trial was 8 months.
interventions.comparator: The groups were compared among then. There is not control group/treatment.

primaryOutcome.outcome: Correlation between postural variables and the time of weekly physical activity as assessed using Photogrammetry and the International Physical Activity Questionnaire.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: Correlation between thoracic kyphosis angle and the time of weekly physical activity as assessed using Photogrammetry and the International Physical Activity Questionnaire.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria: Inclusion criteria: elderly aged or over 60 years, being a participant of the Project for the Promotion of Health of the Elderly of Catholic University of Brasilia; take part in the research and complete the Informed Consent and to their voluntary participation in research .
eligibility.exclusivecriteria: Exclusion criteria: having cognitive impairment; take drugs that influence and / or impossible to maintain the standing position and postural control such as psychotropic, anxiolytic and / or anticholinergics; have disease or injury that influence and / or impossible to maintain the standing position and postural control, have been treated in some orthopedic surgery that influences and / or interfere with the posture of a result of the sequel (s) from the same; pain to maintain the standing position during the time postural assessment, have signs of depression have congenital deformity and / or acquired.

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this study was to perform the correlation between the pattern and level postural physical activity in healthy elderly women. The main hypothesis is that elderly women engaged in physical activity have better posture pattern than sedentary women.
